text: When it comes to Apex Legends,

movement has always
been one of the staples

that separates the game
from its competitors,

like Call of Duty, Rainbow
Six Siege, Valorant,

and other competitive
first-person shooters.
This is only made more apparent

when playing against
highly skilled players.
Shot accuracy helps with being competitive
in Apex Legends.

But what can really set
players apart is movement.

Helpful moves to learn
include wall bouncing;
crouch spamming,

which is when you rapidly
press your crouch button
while simultaneously firing your weapon;
and what we will show you in this video,
bunny hopping, or b-hopping for short.
Bunny hopping is when you carry
the momentum you have created by sliding
into a series of miniature hops.
This can be best utilized
when attempting to use healing items
without losing speed or momentum,

since healing regularly
causes your character
to move very slowly during the process.
Bunny hopping is actually very simple
once you've figured out the timing of it.
First and foremost, you want to make sure
you have your crouch button
set to hold instead of toggle.

To do this, you will
go into your settings,
head to the mouse and keyboard section,
and bind "Crouch (Hold)"

to a key you are comfortable
with on a mouse and keyboard.
For a controller, you will go over to
the controller tab in settings
and switch the crouch button
to "Hold" instead of "Toggle."
Once that setting has been changed,
gather some speed by briefly running,
then slide into a jump,
and while holding the crouch button,
simultaneously press the jump button
as your character touches the ground.

The best way to maintain
momentum while doing this

is to zigzag or move in a
pattern that looks like this.
Once you've mastered bunny hopping,
you will find that your movements
will be more efficient
and you can cover more ground faster,
gaining a significant competitive edge.
